lnazad: Linu > Linux easy. Linux > Windo: .bin just means binary. Usually it is an executable program but it could describe anything
it's an image from a cd.. I want to emulate it.. how ?
If you can convert it to an iso (aks someone else :) ) then you can mount it with the loopback device (mount -o loop) or you can emulate it with qemu
ok but can I use wine to emulate it ?
Probably, if you tell WINE the mountpoint of the image
It would be something like "sudo mount /home/inazad/image.iso /mnt/virtual -o loop" (after converting it) then giving WINE the path "/mnt/virtual" as a CD drive
ok... so I have ton convert my .bin file into an .iso, right ?
Qemu is an emulator. If it a bootable CD then you can use it in Qemu, or if it isn't then install Windows in Qemu and run it like a regular CD in that (but it will still need to be an iso)
an "iso" is just a dump of the contents of a CD. Your "bin" will probably not be that, so it may need converting. If you know what type of program made it then that would help
I don't know which program to use to convert my .bin to an .iso ... HELP!!!
